snippet: The commission proposed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo would be charged with creating a cap on the amount of income a New York State legislator could earn and greater disclosure on how it is earned.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces plans to establish panel to review pay of state's politicians, examining whether pay raises for legislators are merited; commission may also make recommendations for restrictions on outside income; Legislature has pushed for pay raise since 1999, but Cuomo has refused to sign off in face of lawmakers' refusal to agree to ethics reforms.
lead_paragraph: The commission proposed by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo would be charged with creating a cap on the amount of income a New York State legislator could earn and greater disclosure on how it is earned.

headline.main: Cuomo Plans Panel on Legislative Pay and Restricting Outside Income
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Plans Panel on Legislators’ Pay and Limiting Their Other Income
